activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Body Only - Wisconsin and Adjacent States

2:02 PM Defendant Tommy L Robinson not in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman not in court.  Attorney Brian H. Wright in court for State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 22CF72, 22CF197 & 22CF198.
State requests warrant.  Court orders Bench Warrant Body Only Wisconsin and Adjacent States on all files. 

***2:42 p.m. Case recalled.  Attorney Michelle Erdman appears in person with Defendant Tommy L. Robinson.  No one appears for the State and Court relates it's not needed.  Attorney Erdman relates she is only appointed in 22CF72, but willing to take the other 2 files and there is a global resolution.  Court quashes warrants ordered earlier and resets all files for Plea on 12/07/22 at 10:00 a.m.  before Judge Bitney.

Clerked by CK. 
1:18 PM Defendant Tommy L Robinson in court.  Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for Barron County. Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Tommy L Robinson. 
COVERS 22CF72 & 22FO459
State relates and requests a bond modification in 22CF72-Court orders bond be modified to no abusive contact with Victim. 
22FO459-NC plea
Court finds guilty and orders $300.50 forfeiture-60 DTP.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 
Must have no contact with V.A. or her residence. 
Must have no contact with S.B.W. or  N.M.S. 
Must not possess any firearms.

10/12/2022-- AMENDED TO NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH V. A.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

10:55 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tommy L Robinson appeared by video, in custody from Rusk County Jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Tommy L Robinson. 

10:57  Court relates and gives appearances.  This hearing is to reinstate signature bond.
10:57  Atty. Erdman relates.
10:57  Mr. Robinson relates.
10:59  Court quashes warrant previously issued.
Court reinstates signature bond.
10:59  Atty. Erdman and Mr. Robinson go into break-out room; 11:04 return from break-out room.
11:04  Atty. Erdman indicates defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing.
11:05  Court questions defendant; defendant indicates he wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds probable cause; bound over.
Arraignment set; must appear in person.

(MS scanned to Barron Co Jail and e-mailed to Rusk Co Jail)
Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Bail/bond hearing on August 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Def's NOH sent to him at the Rusk Co Jail
Letter from Defendant to Judge Bitney Re:  Request for reinstatement of signature bond and concerns on Attorney

Bail/bond hearing on July 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
NOH sent to Def at Rusk Co Jail and faxed to Rusk Co jail with Zoom info
Letter to Atty Erdman regarding 7/25/22 at 9:30 AM hearing.
Request to Quash Warrant and for New Date

1:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tommy L Robinson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Tommy L Robinson. 
Defendant is employed. Blue form to be provided to the Defendant for court appointed counsel. Previously represented by Attorney Davis. Will contact Attorney Davis for representation. Has another residence to live at.
